intro: Arenaria anatolica, commonly known as Anatolian sandflower, is a flowering plant native to Turkey and parts of the Middle East. It belongs to the Caryophyllaceae family and is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming habit. The plant produces small, white or pink flowers that bloom in early spring. Its leaves are typically linear and covered in fine hairs, adapted to withstand arid conditions. It thrives in sandy or rocky soils and is often found in open, sunny habitats.
